message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

The paper deals with convolutional networks and their ability to generalize to samples not represented in the training data. This is a common problem in computer vision, which falls under the category of cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a new layer to address this problem, which involves learning similarity between neighborhoods of pixels. This is related to machine learning and deep learning, which fall under the categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the advantages of the proposed layer for semantic labeling and cell detection, which are tasks related to natural language processing and bioinformatics, respectively. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also likely sub-categories.
